translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Great Section
1. The Questions of King Milinda

original: Atha kho milindo rājā yenāyasmā nāgaseno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā nāgasenena saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā yena āyasmā nāgasenaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā nāgasenena saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then King Milinda approached the venerable Nāgasena, and after exchanging friendly greetings with him, he sat down to one side.

original: Āyasmāpi kho nāgaseno paṭisammodanīyeneva milindassa rañño cittaṁ ārādhesi.
analyzed: āyasmā api kho nāgasenaḥ paṭisammodanīyena iva milindassa raññaḥ cittam ārādhesi
translated: And the venerable Nāgasena pleased the mind of King Milinda with a suitable talk.

original: Atha kho milindo rājā āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca
translated: Then King Milinda said to the venerable Nāgasena:

analyzed: katham bhadantaḥ ñāyati kinnāmā asi bhantā iti
translated: “How are you known, revered sir? What is your name?”

original: “‘Nāgaseno’ti kho ahaṁ, mahārāja, ñāyāmi, ‘nāgaseno’ti kho maṁ, mahārāja, sabrahmacārī
analyzed: nāgasena uti khalu aha mahā rāja nāyāmi nāgasena uti khalu ma mahā rāja sabrahmacārī
translated: “‘Nāgasena,’ Your Majesty, is how I am known. ‘Nāgasena,’ Your Majesty, is the name my fellows in the Brahma-faring

original: samudācaranti, api ca mātāpitaro nāmaṁ karonti ‘nāgaseno’ti vā ‘sūraseno’ti vā ‘vīraseno’ti
analyzed: samudācaranti api ca mātā pitaraḥ nāmam karonti nāgasena uti vā sūrasena uti vā vīrasena uti
translated: give me. Moreover, parents give a name to a child, whether it is ‘Nāgasena,’ ‘Sūrasena,’ ‘Vīrasena,’

original: vā ‘sīhaseno’ti vā, api ca kho, mahārāja, saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro nāmamattaṁ
analyzed: vā sīhasena uti vā api ca kho mahā rāja saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāraḥ nāmamatta
translated: ‘Sīhasena,’ or what it may be. But, sire, ‘Nāgasena’ is a mere name, a mere designation, a mere conventional expression,

original: yadidaṁ nāgasenoti, na hettha puggalo upalabbhatī”ti.
analyzed: yat idam nāgasena uti na ha ittha puggalaḥ upalabbhati iti
translated: a mere indication, for there is no individual to be found here.”

analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā evam āha
translated: Then King Milinda said:

original: “suṇantu me bhonto pañcasatā yonakā asītisahassā ca bhikkhū, ayaṁ nāgaseno evamāha—
analyzed: suṇantu me bhonto pañca satāḥ yonakāḥ asīti sahassā ca bhikkhū ayam nāgasenaḥ evam āha
translated: “Let my lords, the five hundred Yona teachers, and the eighty thousand monks, listen to me. This Nāgasena says:

original: ‘na hettha puggalo upalabbhatī’ti, kallaṁ nu kho tadabhinanditun”ti.
analyzed: na ha ittha puggalaḥ upalabbhati iti kallam nu kho tat abhinanditun ti
translated: ‘Herein no person is found.’ Is it proper to rejoice in that?”

original: Atha kho milindo rājā āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca
translated: Then King Milinda said to the venerable Nāgasena:

original: “sace, bhante nāgasena, puggalo nūpalabbhati, ko carahi tumhākaṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ
analyzed: sace bhante nāgasena puggalaḥ nu upalabbhati kaḥ carahi tumhākam cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra
translated: “If, revered Nāgasena, a person is not found, then who is it that gives you your robes, almsfood, resting place, and the requisites of medicine when sick?

original: deti, ko taṁ paribhuñjati, ko sīlaṁ rakkhati, ko bhāvanamanuyuñjati, ko maggaphalanibbānāni🔽sacchikaroti, ko pāṇaṁ hanati, ko adinnaṁ ādiyati, ko kāmesumicchācāraṁ carati, ko
analyzed: deti kaḥ tam paribhuñjati kaḥ sīlam rakkhati kaḥ bhāvanam anuyuñjati kaḥ magga phala nibbānāni  sacchikaroti kaḥ pāṇam hanati kaḥ adinnam ādiyati kaḥ kāmesum icchā ācāram carati kaḥ
translated: Who is it that uses them? Who is it that keeps the precepts? Who is it that devotes himself to meditation? Who is it that realizes the paths, the fruits, and Nibbāna?🔽Who is it that kills living beings, takes what is not given, commits sexual misconduct,

original: musā bhaṇati, ko majjaṁ pivati, ko pañcānantariyakammaṁ karoti, tasmā natthi kusalaṁ,
analyzed: musā bhaṇati kaḥ majjam pivati kaḥ pañca ānantariya kammam karoti tasmā natthi kusala
translated: speaks falsely, drinks strong drink, and commits the five crimes with an immediate result? Therefore there is no good conduct,

original: natthi akusalaṁ, natthi kusalākusalānaṁ kammānaṁ kattā vā kāretā vā, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṁ
analyzed: natthi akusala natthi kusala akusalānam kammānam kattā vā kāretā vā natthi su kata dukkaṭāna
translated: There is no bad action, no good or bad action,🔽no doer, no cause, no conditions, no origination,🔽no one who knows, sees, or declares the origination of the world.

original: kammānaṁ phalaṁ vipāko, sace, bhante nāgasena, yo tumhe māreti, natthi tassāpi pāṇātipāto,
analyzed: kammānam phalam vipākaḥ sace bhante nāgasena yaḥ tumhe māreti natthi tassa api pāṇa atipāto
translated: There is no unwholesome, there is no one who does wholesome or unwholesome actions, there is no one who experiences the results of good or bad actions, if, revered Nāgasena, there is no offence in killing you,

original: tumhākampi, bhante nāgasena, natthi ācariyo, natthi upajjhāyo, natthi upasampadā.
analyzed: tumhākam pi bhante nāgasena natthi ācariyaḥ natthi upajjhāyaḥ natthi upasampadā
translated: then, revered Nāgasena, you have no teacher, you have no preceptor, you have no higher ordination.”

original: ‘Nāgasenoti maṁ, mahārāja, sabrahmacārī samudācarantī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamo ettha nāgaseno?
analyzed: nāgasena uti ma mahā rāja sabrahmacārī samudācaranti iti yam vadesi katamaḥ ettha nāgasenaḥ
translated: “If, sire, your fellow-brahmans address you as ‘Nāgasena,’ which of these is Nāgasena?

original: Kiṁ nu kho, bhante, kesā nāgaseno”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu bhante kesāḥ nāgasena uti
translated: Now, revered sir, are the head-hairs Nāgasena?”
“No, sire.”
“Are the body-hairs Nāgasena?”
“No, sire.”
“Are the nails …
the teeth …
the skin …🔽the flesh …
the sinews …
the bones …🔽the bone-marrow …🔽the kidneys …🔽the heart …
the liver …🔽the pleura …🔽the spleen …
the lungs …🔽the bowels …
the mesentery …🔽the undigested food …🔽the excrement …🔽the bile …
the phlegm …
the pus …🔽the blood …
the sweat …🔽the fat …🔽the tears …🔽the grease …
the spittle …
the snot …🔽the grease …
the urine …
the brain in the head, Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”

analyzed: kim nu khalu bhante rūpam nāgasena uti
translated: “Then, revered sir, is the visible-form Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”
“Is the feeling Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”
“Is the perception Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”
“Are the (volitional) processes Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”
“Is the consciousness Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”

analyzed: kim pana bhante rūpa vedanā saññā saṅkhāra viññāṇam nāgasena uti
translated: “Then, revered sir, is the visible-form, feeling, perception, (volitional) processes, and consciousness Nāgasena?”
“No, Great King.”

analyzed: kim pana bhante aññatra rūpa vedanā saññā saṅkhāra viññāṇam nāgasena uti
translated: “Then, revered sir, is Nāgasena apart from the visible-form, feeling, perception, (volitional) processes, and consciousness?”
“No, Great King.”

original: “Tamahaṁ, bhante, pucchanto pucchanto na passāmi nāgasenaṁ.
analyzed: tam aha bhante pucchantaḥ pucchantaḥ na passāmi nāgasena
translated: “Revered sir, asking and asking I do not see Nāgasena.

analyzed: nāgasena saddaḥ iva nu kho bhante nāgasenaḥ ti
translated: Is the mere sound ‘Nāgasena’ Nāgasena, revered sir?”
“No, Great King.”

original: “Ko panettha nāgaseno, alikaṁ tvaṁ, bhante, bhāsasi musāvādaṁ, natthi nāgaseno”ti.
analyzed: kaḥ pana ittha nāgasenaḥ alikam tva bhante bhāsasi musāvāda natthi nāgasenaḥ ti
translated: “But, Nāgasena, who is it here? You are speaking falsely, Reverend Sir, you are lying, there is no Nāgasena.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgaseno milindaṁ rājānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā nāgasenaḥ milindam rājānam etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Nāgasena said this to King Milinda:

original: “tvaṁ khosi, mahārāja, khattiyasukhumālo accantasukhumālo, tassa te, mahārāja, majjhanhikasamayaṁ
analyzed: tvam kho asi mahā rāja khattiya sukhumālaḥ accanta sukhumālaḥ tassa te mahā rāja majjhanhika samaya
translated: “You, sire, are a prince, delicate, very delicate, and at midday, sire,

original: tattāya bhūmiyā uṇhāya vālikāya kharāya sakkharakathalikāya madditvā pādenāgacchantassa
analyzed: tattāya bhūmiyāḥ uṇhāya vālikāya kharāya sakkhara kathalikāya madditvā pādena āgacchantassa
translated: having walked on that hot ground, on hot sand, on hot gravel, with your feet,

original: pādā rujjanti, kāyo kilamati, cittaṁ upahaññati, dukkhasahagataṁ kāyaviññāṇaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: pādāḥ rujjanti kāyaḥ kilamati cittam upahaññati dukkha sahagatam kāya viññāṇam uppajjati
translated: your feet would be sore, your body would be tired, your mind would be troubled, bodily consciousness accompanied by pain would arise,

original: kiṁ nu kho tvaṁ pādenāgatosi, udāhu vāhanenā”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu tvam pādena āgataḥ asi udāhu vāhanena ati
translated: would you have come on foot, or have you come in a vehicle?”

analyzed: na aha bhante pādena āgacchāmi rathena aham āgataḥ asmi iti
translated: “I have not come on foot, revered sir, I have come in a chariot.”

original: “Sace tvaṁ, mahārāja, rathenāgatosi, rathaṁ me ārocehi, kiṁ nu kho, mahārāja, īsā ratho”ti?
analyzed: sace tva mahā rāja rathena āgataḥ asi ratham me ārocehi kim nu khalu mahā rāja
translated: “If you have come in a chariot, sire, tell me about the chariot. Now, sire, is the pole the chariot?”
“No, revered sir.”
“Is the axle the chariot?”
“No, revered sir.”
“Are the wheels the chariot?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“Is the chariot the axle?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“Is the chariot the wheels?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“Is the chariot the frame?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“Is the chariot the flagpole?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“Is the chariot the fittings?”
“No, venerable sir.”

analyzed: kim nu khalu mahā rāja īsā akkha cakka ratha pañjara ratha daṇḍa yuga rasmi patodāḥ
translated: “Then, sire, is the chariot the pole, the axle, the wheels, the frame, the flagpole and the fittings?”
“No, venerable sir.”

analyzed: kim pana mahā rāja aññatra īsā akkha cakka ratha pañjara ratha daṇḍa yuga rasmi patodāḥ
translated: “Then, sire, is the chariot other than the pole, the axle, the wheels, the frame, the flagpole and the fittings?”
“No, venerable sir.”

original: “Tamahaṁ, mahārāja, pucchanto pucchanto na passāmi rathaṁ.
analyzed: tam aha mahā rāja pucchantaḥ pucchantaḥ na passāmi ratha
translated: “I, sire, asking and asking, do not see the chariot.

analyzed: nu khalu mahā rāja rathaḥ iti
translated: Is the mere word ‘chariot’ the chariot?”
“No, venerable sir.”

original: “Ko panettha ratho, alikaṁ tvaṁ, mahārāja, bhāsasi musāvādaṁ, natthi ratho, tvaṁsi,
analyzed: kaḥ pana ittha rathaḥ alikam tva mahā rāja bhāsasi musāvāda natthi ratho tvasi
translated: “Then, sire, what is the chariot? You are speaking falsely, you are speaking falsely, sire. There is no chariot. You are speaking falsely, sire, in saying that there is no chariot.

original: mahārāja, sakalajambudīpe aggarājā, kassa pana tvaṁ bhāyitvā musāvādaṁ bhāsasi, suṇantu
analyzed: mahā rāja sakala jambudīpe agga rājā kassa pana tvam bhāyitvā musāvādam bhāsasi suṇantu
translated: “Great king, you are the chief king of all of India, whom are you afraid of that you speak a lie?”🔽“Listen, great king,

original: me bhonto pañcasatā yonakā asītisahassā ca bhikkhū, ayaṁ milindo rājā evamāha—
analyzed: me bhonto pañca satāḥ yonakāḥ asīti sahassā ca bhikkhū ayam milindaḥ rājā evam āha
translated: “Great king, you are the chief king in all of India, but whom are you afraid of that you speak a lie? Let the five hundred Yona teachers and the eighty thousand monks listen to me, Your Majesty. This King Milinda says:

original: ‘rathenāhaṁ āgatosmī’ti, sace tvaṁ, mahārāja, rathenāgatosi, ‘rathaṁ me ārocehī’ti vutto samāno rathaṁ na sampādeti, kallaṁ nu kho tadabhinanditun”ti.
analyzed: rathena aham āgataḥ asmi iti sace tva mahā rāja rathena āgataḥ asi ratham me ārocehi iti vuttaḥ samānaḥ ratham na sampādeti kallam nu kho tat abhinanditunti
translated: ‘I have come by chariot.’ If you have come by chariot, when asked ‘Show me the chariot,’ you do not show the chariot. Is it right to rejoice in that?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, pañcasatā yonakā āyasmato nāgasenassa sādhukāraṁ datvā milindaṁ rājānaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: evam vutte pañcasatāḥ yonakāḥ āyasmataḥ nāgasenassa sādhukāram da tvā milindam rājānam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the five hundred Yona teachers gave their approval to the venerable Nāgasena and said this to King Milinda:

analyzed: idāni kho tva mahā rāja sakkontaḥ bhāsassu iti
translated: “Now, Your Majesty, being able, speak.”

original: Atha kho milindo rājā āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca—🔽“nāhaṁ, bhante nāgasena, musā bhaṇāmi, īsañca paṭicca akkhañca paṭicca cakkāni ca
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca  na aha bhante nāgasena musā bhaṇāmi īsañca paṭicca akkhañca paṭicca cakkāni ca
translated: Then King Milinda said this to the venerable Nāgasena:

original: paṭicca rathapañjarañca paṭicca rathadaṇḍakañca paṭicca ‘ratho’ti saṅkhā samaññā
analyzed: paṭicca ratha pañjarañca paṭicca ratha daṇḍakañca paṭicca rathaḥ uti saṅkhā samaññā
translated: “Venerable Nāgasena, I do not speak falsely. The designation, the appellation, the designation of conventional language, the designation of worldly convention, the designation of social usage, the designation of description, the designation of designation, the designation of name, the designation of form, the designation of the world, the designation of the world’s conventions, the designation of the world’s designations, the designation of the world’s descriptions, the designation of the world’s names, the designation of the world’s forms, the designation of the world’s designation of a chariot, in regard to the pole, in regard to the axle, in regard to the wheels,🔽in regard to the frame, in regard to the flag-staff, in regard to the yoke, in regard to the reins, in regard to the goad, in regard to the seat, in regard to the bullocks, in regard to the harness, in regard to the driver, in regard to the load, in regard to the destination, in regard to the place, in regard to the country, in regard to the region, in regard to the town, in regard to the village, in regard to the city, in regard to the market, in regard to the crossroads, in regard to the junction, in regard to the street, in regard to the lane, in regard to the road, in regard to the path, in regard to the footway, in regard to the footbridge, in regard to the ford, in regard to the river, in regard to the ocean, in regard to the mountain, in regard to the forest, in regard to the tree, in regard to the creeper, in regard to the grass, in regard to the bush, in regard to the herb, in regard to

analyzed: paññatti vohāraḥ nāma mattam pavattati iti
translated: the designation, the expression, the name, the concept, the conventional usage, the designation does not occur.”

analyzed: sādhu khalu tva mahā rāja ratham jānāsi
translated: “It is good that you know the chariot, great king.

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, mayhampi kese ca paṭicca lome ca paṭicca …pe… matthake matthaluṅgañca
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja mayham pi kese ca paṭicca lome ca paṭicca pe matthake mattha luṅgañca
translated: In the same way, great king, the designation, the expression, the name, the concept, the conventional usage, the designation ‘Nāgasena’ occurs in dependence on the head-hairs, body-hairs, nails, teeth,🔽skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone-marrow, kidney,🔽heart, liver, midriff, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, contents of the stomach, feces,

original: paṭicca rūpañca paṭicca vedanañca paṭicca saññañca paṭicca saṅkhāre ca paṭicca viññāṇañca🔽paṭicca ‘nāgaseno’ti saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro nāmamattaṁ pavattati, paramatthato
analyzed: paṭicca rūpañca paṭicca vedanañca paṭicca saññañca paṭicca saṅkhāre ca paṭicca viññāṇañca  paṭicca nāgasenaḥ ti saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāraḥ nāma mattam pavattati paramatthato
translated: and in dependence on the eye-element, form-element, eye-consciousness-element, ear-element, sound-element, ear-consciousness-element, nose-element, smell-element, nose-consciousness-element, tongue-element, taste-element, tongue-consciousness-element, body-element, touch-element, body-consciousness-element, mind-element, mental-object-element, mind-consciousness-element,🔽but in the ultimate sense
no person is apprehended.

original: Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, vajirāya bhikkhuniyā bhagavato sammukhā—
analyzed: mahā rāja vajirāya bhikkhuniyāḥ bhagavataḥ sammukhā
translated: And this was said, great king, by the nun Vajirā in the presence of the Blessed One:
‘Just as when the parts are assembled
The word “chariot” is used,
So when the aggregates are present
The convention “living being” is used.’“

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante nāgasena, abbhutaṁ, bhante nāgasena, aticitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni
analyzed: acchariya bhante nāgasena abbhuta bhante nāgasena ati citrāni pañha paṭibhānāni
translated: “It is wonderful, revered Nāgasena, it is marvellous, revered Nāgasena, how various are the answers to the questions.

original: visajjitāni, yadi buddho tiṭṭheyya sādhukāraṁ dadeyya, sādhu sādhu, nāgasena, aticitrāni
analyzed: visajjitāni yadi buddhaḥ tiṭṭheyya sādhukāram dadeyya sādhu sādhu nāgasena ati citrāni
translated: If the Buddha were alive he would give his approval, Well done, Well done, Nāgasena, most wonderful,
most excellent are your answers to the questions.”
The first discussion, on the designation.
